text: Lee County is a county in the U.S. state of Alabama. As of the 2020 census, the population was 174,241. The county seat is Opelika, and the largest city is Auburn. The county is named for General Robert E. Lee (1807â€“1870), who served as General in Chief of the Armies of the Confederate States in 1865. == References == Category:Alabama counties Category:1866 establishments in Alabama
title: Lee County, Alabama
